Class Elevator

extends java.lang.Object
    Since:
    2011-09-14

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Elevator()
      Elevator constructor This constructor sets the starting floor and direction.

      Boards a passenger on the Elevator.

      Switches the direction of the Elevator This method performs bounds checking on the Elevator's current floor and, if necessary, will switch the direction.

      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      main This code creates an Elevator object, boards passengers to the Elevator hw1 spec, then has the Elevator object sweep (move) to all floors in the building letting off passengers at their destinations and printing an Elevator status along the way.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Elevator

        public Elevator()
        Elevator constructor This constructor sets the starting floor and direction. It is also responsible for initializing state variables to track Floors and Passengers.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        main This code creates an Elevator object, boards passengers to the Elevator hw1 spec, then has the Elevator object sweep (move) to all floors in the building letting off passengers at their destinations and printing an Elevator status along the way.
        Parameters:
        args - No parameters are used here.

      • move

        public void move()
        Move the Elevator through the floors. This method moves the Elevator through the floors in the building. It performs bounds checking by switching the direction if the Elevator has reached the top or the bottom of the building. In addition, this method also increments the currentFloor variable by a value of +1 or -1, depending on the currentDirection variable of the Elevator.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop the Elevator and allow passengers to exit. When this method is called it clears the object state variables for the current floor. This includes setting the destination floor of the current floor to false, and clearing any queued passengers for this floor. Finally, it prints a status message about stopping on a floor, then calls the overloaded toString() method to print the Elevator status.

      • doSwitchDirection

        public void doSwitchDirection()
        Switches the direction of the Elevator This method performs bounds checking on the Elevator's current floor and, if necessary, will switch the direction.

      • isDestinationFloor

        public boolean isDestinationFloor()
        Validates if current floor is a destination floor. This method returns the true/false value of the currentFloor member of the destinationFloor array to indiciate if the currentFloor is a destination floor.
        Returns:
        true = floor is destination, false if not.

      • getPassengerCount

        public int getPassengerCount()
        Returns the count of passengers This method iterates through all of the buildling floors and totals the passengers destined for each floor. The method returns this count.
        Returns:
        passenger count on Elevator

      • boardPassenger

        public void boardPassenger(int floor)
        Boards a passenger on the Elevator. This method performs the action of boarding a passenger on the Elevator. This requires setting the floor passed as a parameter as a destination floor. This is done regardless if it was previously a destination floor or not. It then increments the number of passengers destined for that floor by 1.
        Parameters:
        floor - Floor number the passenger wishes to travel to.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the status of the Elevator object This method is an overloaded toString method to return Elevator floor and passenger count.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Status containing passenger count and current floor
